articles.title: CPRK Spokesman Denounces Traitor Lee Myung Bak of S. Korea
articles.content:
CPRK Spokesman Denounces Traitor Lee Myung Bak of S. Korea

					Pyongyang, December 8 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of Korea gave the following answer to a question put by KCNA on Thursday as regards the fact that traitor Lee Myung Bak of south Korea praised those human derelicts who dared to insult the dignity of the DPRK supreme leadership:
					
					Traitor Lee recently sent a "letter of encouragement" to the human scum, who wrought a nonsensical novel viciously slandering the dignity of the DPRK supreme leadership, and revealed his true colors as a confrontation element once again only to touch off the anger of all people. 
					
					In the letter Lee expressed "thanks" for the novel, making disgusting remarks that it, a compilation of fabrications, fiction and daydream, informs people of the north's reality and implants the will for "unification" in their mind. 
					
					Nobody showed interest in the absurd talk by such lunatic, but only the chief executive of south Korea hailed the writer with "encouragement". This clearly shows where he is. 
					
					As nominal "president", he should have minded his honor, though he is narrow-minded and driven into a tight corner by attacks at home and abroad and chaos in south Korea. 
					
					Without feeling disgrace, the traitor could not but depend on such human derelicts cold-treated and forsaken even in south Korean society. It shows well his meanness and poor situation 
					
					What should not be overlooked is the reckless behavior of the traitor who would unhesitatingly slander the DPRK over anything whether it is fabrication or fiction.
					
					The reality goes to prove he is the very one that incites confrontation with fellow countrymen. 
					
					How can the north-south relations improve and how can the Koreans achieve national reconciliation and unity when the south Korean chief executive is obsessed with conception of confrontation and is always scheming to hurt fellow countrymen?
					
					The recent behavior of the traitor convinced us once again that there was and would be no change in his real intention to go for confrontation to the last in disregard of the trend of the times and the public sentiment. 
					
					The people of the DPRK will never pardon anyone who hurts the inviolable dignity of the DPRK supreme leadership even a bit.

articles.title: DPRK Order Awarded to Chinese Embassy Official
articles.content:
DPRK Order Awarded to Chinese Embassy Official

					Pyongyang, December 8 (KCNA) -- Order of DPRK Friendship 2nd Class was awarded to Sun Yanfeng, military, naval and air attache of the Chinese embassy here. 
					
					Sun made contributions to the development of the relations of friendship and cooperation between the armies of the DPRK and China with boundless reverence for President Kim Il Sung and Supreme Commander of the Korean People's Army Kim Jong Il. 
					
					A ceremony of awarding the order took place at the Mansudae Assembly Hall here on Thursday. 
					
					Present there were Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, generals and officers of the KPA, and Liu Hongcai, Chinese ambassador to the DPRK, and staff members of the Chinese embassy.

articles.title: Joint Declaration of Korean Buddhists Issued
articles.content:
Joint Declaration of Korean Buddhists Issued

					Pyongyang, December 8 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of the Buddhist Federation of Korea and the BFK National Believers' Association and the south Korean Movement for Recovering Cultural Treasures and the Council of the South Korean Buddhist Jogye Order issued the following north-south joint declaration of Buddhists on Thursday.
					
					Returned to the Korean nation in 80 odd years were books that record royal events kept in the room of the king of Korea, robbed by the "Government General in Korea" during the Japanese imperialists' occupation of it. 
					
					In 2010 the Japanese government decided to return 1 205 books including the said books with the lapse of 100 years after the fabrication of the "Korea-Japan annexation" as an occasion. This was a result of the joint efforts made by Buddhists in the north and the south of Korea since 2006.
					
					The Buddhists in the north and the south will jointly work harder to retake the national cultural assets, looted by the Japanese imperialists, under the banner of "By our nation itself".
					
					Furthermore, they will pool efforts of 70 million compatriots to urge Japan's reflection of its colonial rule and positively contribute to accelerating the country's reunification, the cherished desire of the nation. 
					
					We will jointly work to hold a "north-south seminar for retaking cultural treasures looted by the Japanese imperialists" with the return of the royal books, an achievement made by the June 15 national cooperation despite difficulties and hardships, as a momentum.

articles.title: DPRK Ambassador to UK Appointed
articles.content:
DPRK Ambassador to UK Appointed

					Pyongyang, December 8 (KCNA) -- Hyon Hak Bong was appointed as DPRK ambassador to the UK, according to a decree of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK.

articles.title: Russian Ambassador Hosts Friendly Gathering
articles.content:
Russian Ambassador Hosts Friendly Gathering

					Pyongyang, December 8 (KCNA) -- Valery Sukhinin, Russian ambassador to the DPRK, Thursday hosted a friendly meeting at his embassy on the occasion of the new year Juche 101 (2012).
					
					Present there on invitation were Director-General Mun Song Mo and officials of the General Bureau of Diplomatic Corps Affairs.
					
					Staff members of the embassy were on hand.
					
					Speeches were made at the meeting.
					
					The participants talked to each other about the matter of further developing the relations between the two countries, deepening friendship.

articles.title: DPRK Premier Makes Field Survey of Hwanghae Iron and Steel Complex
articles.content:
DPRK Premier Makes Field Survey of Hwanghae Iron and Steel Complex

					Pyongyang, December 8 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Choe Yong Rim on Thursday made field survey of the Hwanghae Iron and Steel Complex.
					
					After going round construction sites of sintering furnace and lime roasting furnace, large-scale oxygen plant shop, gas producer, strand-casting machine, etc, he convened a consultative meeting.
					
					Discussed there were the matters of completing production processes now under construction at an early date to produce in time heavy rails urgently needed in different domains of the national economy. It took concrete measures for relevant units to supply enough raw and other materials to the complex.

articles.title: Servicemen's Art Performance Wins Acclaim in Pyongyang
articles.content:
Servicemen's Art Performance Wins Acclaim in Pyongyang

					Pyongyang, December 8 (KCNA) -- Company soldiers' art performance is going on at the People's Palace of Culture in Pyongyang, drawing many people.  They proved successful at the 35th art festival of the Korean People's Army
					
					The performance begins with poem recital "Recollecting General's Jeep" about Supreme Commander Kim Jong Il's Songun (military-first) leadership. 
					
					The numbers include dialogic poem "General and Our Snow Flower Company", harmonica solo "The Kitchen Wagon Runs" and interlude "Strong Solider."
					
					The performance gives a vivid representation of servicepersons' noble spiritual world and their high artistry.  
					
					After appreciating the performance, Kim Kwang Chol, a 54-year-old resident in Pothonggang District, told KCNA:
					
					"Their performance is great. I am really encouraged by it. I will live and work like them who are performing feats in military service."
					
					Pak Un Hyok, a 37-year-old citizen from Taedonggang District, said:
					
					"The performance reminded me of my military service days. It mirrors the servicepersons' strong will to remain faithful to their supreme commander, smash the enemy and reunify the country. Encouraged by them, I will work hard for the building of a thriving nation."

articles.title: Many Modern Fruit Farms Built in DPRK
articles.content:
Many Modern Fruit Farms Built in DPRK

					Pyongyang, December 8 (KCNA) -- Many fruit farms have been built on a modern basis in the DPRK.
					
					Several thousand hectares of orchards have appeared in Pyongyang, Kosan, Ryongjon, Toksong and other areas of the country.
					
					The fruit farms carried out such projects as rezoning many hectares, digging holes, installing concrete props and constructing roads and waterways in a short span of time.
					
					They made dwarf apple tree fields in flatland.  
					
					They produce fruits in a scientific and technological way.
					
					They also set up a system of cultivating high-yielding fruit saplings like pear, plum, peach, apricot and vine, and nursing varieties of fruit trees.  
					
					The fruit farms have employed new methods of improving nutritive conditions of apple trees, protecting them from noxious insects and spraying agricultural chemicals.  
					
					A ring-shaped cyclic production system is available for fruit farming and stockbreeding.

articles.title: Sportspersons Honored with Title of People's Athlete
articles.content:
Sportspersons Honored with Title of People's Athlete

					Pyongyang, December 8 (KCNA) ? An estimated 200 sportspersons have won the title of People's Athlete in the DPRK over the past 45 years since the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly issued a decree on the institution of the title in Juche 55 (1966).
					
					Sin Kum Dan and Pak Tu Ik were the first in the country to take the title.
					
					Sin set new world records eleven times in international track-and-field tournaments, bagging many gold medals, while Pak played a big role in the DPRK team's defeat of the Italian team in the 8th World Cup. 
					
					Afterwards, a lot of sportspersons were honored with the title after scoring good results in international tournaments.
					
					Pak Yong Sun won the women's singles of the World Table-tennis Championship two times, Ku Yong Jo took a gold medal in men's boxing event of the 21st Olympic Games and Ri Ho Jun renewed the world record in men's shooting event of the 20th Olympic Games. 
					
					Jong Song Ok won women's marathon of the 7th World Track-and-Field Championship and Kye Sun Hui took four gold medals in world judo championships. Kim Il, Pae Kil Su and Ri Song Hui also won gold medals in Olympic games and world championships.  
					
					Hong Chang Su, Jong Tae Se and An Yong Hak, Koreans living in Japan, were also honored with the title of People's Athlete.
					
					Kim Chun Phil, Choe Kwang Sok and other competent coaches are also winners of the title.

articles.title: Chongnyu Restaurant in Pyongyang Enjoys Popularity
articles.content:
Chongnyu Restaurant in Pyongyang Enjoys Popularity

					Pyongyang, December 8 (KCNA) -- The Chongnyu Restaurant is located on the banks of the picturesque Pothong River in Pyongyang. 
					
					The restaurant is popular for serving Pyongyang cold noodle, sinsollo (dish in cooking brazier), meat with cooked vegetables, roast meat, broiled eel, mung-bean and potato pancakes and mullet soup.   
					
					Pyongyang cold noodle, sinsollo, meat with cooked vegetables and roast meat are most popular among the dishes.
					
					President Kim Il Sung visited the restaurant on December 6, Juche 70 (1981) and named it "Chongnyu Restaurant". 
					
					Leader Kim Jong Il paid deep concern to the construction and operation of the restaurant. A few years ago he took measures to reconstruct it as required by the new century.

articles.title: Popun Temple, Cultural Heritage of Korean Nation
articles.content:
Popun Temple, Cultural Heritage of Korean Nation

					Pyongyang, December 8 (KCNA) -- The Popun Temple is located in the southern part of Mt. Ryongak in Pyongyang. It was built in the period of Koguryo Kingdom (277 B.C.-668 A.D.) and reconstructed several times in the period of Ri Dynasty (1392-1910). 
					
					The temple, built at the foot of a bluff cliff, consists of a main building, Chilsong Pavilion, Sansin Pavilion and Toksong Pavilion. 
					
					The colorfully painted main building has a crane-shaped roof propped up by 14 pillars. 
					
					There is an 86.5 cm high Buddhist statute inside the main building. 
					
					The Chilsong Pavilion in the rear of the temple is a Buddhist sanctum where sacrifices were made to the Great Bear. 
					
					The Sansin and Toksong pavilions are small buildings.  
					
					Leader Kim Jong Il visited the temple in January Juche 98 (2009) and watched a priest praying to Amitabha.
					
					The Popun Temple is one of the Korean nation's valuable cultural heritages.

articles.title: S. Korean Chief Executive Indicted for Illegality
articles.content:
S. Korean Chief Executive Indicted for Illegality

					Pyongyang, December 8 (KCNA) -- The opposition Democratic Labor Party of south Korea brought to the prosecution an indictment disclosing the crimes of the chief executive and his wife who committed extra-large illegality and corruption, according to the south Korean MBC on Tuesday. 
					
					The indictment said it is illegality that the chief executive abused power to buy cheap a lot in Naegok-dong of Seoul for a mansion in which he will reside in after his retirement.

articles.title: Racket of Suppression Intensified in S. Korea
articles.content:
Racket of Suppression Intensified in S. Korea

					Pyongyang, December 8 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet authorities have kicked up a racket of repression on the pretext of the "spy-ring case", an anti-DPRK farce. 
					
					On December 6 the puppet Inchon District Police Agency searched the house of a graduate student over this case and confiscated his computer and books.
					
					This repression was made for such assertion that he exchanged data on the north with a person involved in the case. 
					
					The fascist authorities summoned at random at least 110 people allegedly to find evidence and are conducting search operations in different parts while trying those detained on charges of involvement in the case.

articles.title: Koreans in China Demands Release of Rev. Han Sang Ryol
articles.content:
Koreans in China Demands Release of Rev. Han Sang Ryol

					Pyongyang, December 8 (KCNA) -- The General Association of Koreans in China issued a statement Tuesday in denunciation of the south Korean authorities' repression of Rev. Han Sang Ryol.
					
					Some time ago, the south Korean puppet supreme court finally sentenced Rev. Han, who visited the DPRK last year to mark the 10th anniversary of the June 15 joint declaration, to three years of imprisonment and three years of suspension of qualification by invoking the "National Security Law", the statement charged. 
					
					His visit to the DPRK was an expression of the rock-firm will to devote himself to stirring up the patriotic desire for reunification of the fellow countrymen and providing the continuity of advance toward independent reunification, it said, adding: 
					
					All things he did in the DPRK are quite righteous as they were for promoting the national harmony and realizing the peace and reunification of the country in the spirit of the June 15 joint declaration.
					
					Nevertheless, the south Korean authorities arrested him the moment he went over Panmunjom and had inflicted untold persecution on him for a long time before imposing such heavy punishment.
					
					Urging them to cancel the punishment and set free Rev. Han at once, the statement said:
					
					The reality clearly shows it is impossible to expect democracy in south Korean society and independent reunification of the country as long as the puppet traitor is allowed to stay in power.

articles.title: Important Days of DPRK Observed
articles.content:
Important Days of DPRK Observed

					Pyongyang, December 8 (KCNA) -- Meetings, seminars and book and photo exhibitions took place in Italy, Nepal and Mexico on Dec. 2 and 3. They marked the 20th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's assumption of supreme commandership of the Korean People's Army and the 94th birth anniversary of Kim Jong Suk, an anti-Japanese war hero.
					
					Displayed in the venues were works of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il, photos on their immortal exploits and books and photos introducing the Korean people in their efforts to build socialism.
					
					The secretary general of the Italian Committee for the Study of the Juche idea said at a meeting that Kim Jong Il has always led the Korean People's Army to victory with his matchless grit, iron will and farsighted wisdom.
					
					The president of the Group of Dialectical Materialists of Italy in a speech said: The greatest feat of Kim Jong Suk is that she brought up Kim Jong Il as the sun of future. Her feat will remain long in the Korean and world history of women's movement.
					
					The minister of State for Energy of Nepal said in a seminar that under the leadership of Kim Jong Il the DPRK has demonstrated to the whole world its dignity and might, smashing all sorts of challenges and moves of the imperialist allied forces.
					
					The president of the Mexican Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism and other speakers noted that Kim Jong Il has reliably defended the dignity and sovereignty of the country and nation with his Songun politics and that Kim Jong Suk, woman commander of Mt. Paektu, performed undying exploits for the country and revolution.
					
					A message of greeting to Kim Jong Il was adopted at the event in Nepal.

articles.title: Nepali Paper Marks DPRK Anniversaries
articles.content:
Nepali Paper Marks DPRK Anniversaries

					Pyongyang, December 8 (KCNA) -- The Nepali paper Rahasha on December 1 carried an article titled "December 24 of the DPRK" to mark the 20th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's assumption of  supreme commandership of the Korean People's Army and the 94th birth anniversary of Kim Jong Suk, an anti-Japanese war hero.
					
					The paper said:
					
					December 24 is a significant day in the DPRK.
					
					On December 24, 1991, leader Kim Jong Il assumed the KPA supreme commandership.
					
					After his assumption, he has built up the KPA into an invincible army, thus repelling the imperialists' moves for aggression on the DPRK and reliably guaranteeing the security of socialist Korea.
					
					On December 24, 1917, Kim Jong Suk, revered long as an anti-Japanese war hero by the Korean people, was born.
					
					Her distinguished feat is that she provided a sure guarantee for carrying forward the socialist cause through generations in the DPRK.
					
					On December 24, 2008, a torch of fresh revolutionary surge was kindled in the DPRK.
					
					Giving field guidance to the Chollima Steel Complex Kim Jong Il called for kindling this torch for building a thriving nation.
					
					The Mexican paper Unidad Nacional on November 30 carried an article on the undying feats performed by Kim Jong Suk for Korea's liberation, building of a new country and the development of women's movement.

articles.title: Koreans in Russia Mark Important Days of DPRK
articles.content:
Koreans in Russia Mark Important Days of DPRK

					Pyongyang, December 8 (KCNA) -- The United Confederation of Koreans in Far Eastern Region of Russia held a meeting in Nakhodka on Dec. 2 to mark the 20th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's assumption of supreme commandership of the Korean People's Army and the 94th birth anniversary of Kim Jong Suk, an anti-Japanese war hero.
					
					The participants laid a floral basket and bouquets before the full- length portraits of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il to pay tribute to them.
					
					Speakers at the meeting said that Kim Jong Il has demonstrated to the whole world the dignity and might of the Korean nation with his inexhaustible Songun revolutionary leadership.
					
					He has devoted his all to building a socialist thriving nation in which the people will lead a happy life with nothing to envy, as desired by mother Kim Jong Suk, they noted.
					
					Then an art performance was given by Korean artistes.
					
					That day the participants watched the Korean film "Pyongyang Today".
					
					They also looked round exhibits on display at the meeting hall. The exhibits included photos on the exploits performed by Kim Jong Il through his revolutionary activities and photos, books and publications showing the army and people of the DPRK in their heroic drive to accelerate national reunification and socialist construction.

articles.title: Hu Jintao Refers to Issue for Strengthening Naval Force
articles.content:
Hu Jintao Refers to Issue for Strengthening Naval Force

					Beijing, December 7 (KCNA) -- Chinese President Hu Jintao on Tuesday met deputies of the Party congress of People's Liberation Army (PLA) Navy and attendants for the meeting of the PLA's armament work. 
					
					He underlined the need to promote the fine traditions of the PLA, accelerate the transformation and modernization of the Navy in a sturdy way, and make extended preparations for warfare in order to make greater contributions to safeguarding national security and world peace.

articles.title: Respect for Sovereignty of Afghans: Chinese FM
articles.content:
Respect for Sovereignty of Afghans: Chinese FM

					Pyongyang, December 8 (KCNA) -- The peace process in Afghanistan has to be an "Afghan-led and Afghan-owned" one, said Chinese Foreign Minister Yang Jiechi in addressing the International Afghanistan Conference held on Monday.
					
					Yang stressed that the future of Afghanistan depends on the Afghan people, adding that the international community should respect Afghanistan's independence, sovereignty and territorial integrity.

articles.title: China Calls for Scientific Development of Army
articles.content:
China Calls for Scientific Development of Army

					Beijing, December 7 (KCNA) -- Guo Boxiong, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of China, called for opening up a new phase in developing the army in a scientific way.
					
					During his recent inspection tour of the Nanjing Military District and Second Artillery Unit, he underscored the need to give priority to promoting a scientific development of the defense industry and the army and increasing the combat capability of army.

articles.title: China Rejects Unreasonable Demand over Carbon Dioxide Emissions
articles.content:
China Rejects Unreasonable Demand over Carbon Dioxide Emissions

					Pyongyang, December 8 (KCNA) -- Su Wei, Chinese representative to the talks on climate change, rejected the unreasonable demand over the issue of carbon dioxide emissions.    
					
					Speaking at a press conference held in Durban, South Africa, recently he said that it is unfair to urge developing nations to take a large share in cutting carbon dioxide emissions. 
					
					Saying that the demand does not accord with the international convention, the representative called on the U.S. and European countries to take the lead in cutting carbon dioxide emissions.

articles.title: Russia to Strengthen Naval Force
articles.content:
Russia to Strengthen Naval Force

					Moscow, December 7 (KCNA) -- Russia is continuing to pay big efforts to strengthening the naval force.
					
					C-400, the first surface-to-air missile complex of the new generation, will be commissioned in the Baltic Sea Fleet of Russia before the end of this year, the commander of the fleet said recently.
					
					It is said that C-400 is being delivered according to the state plan for re-equipment and will be replaced by C-200.

articles.title: Anniversary of Start of Counter-Attack on Fascist German Aggressors Marked in Russia
articles.content:
Anniversary of Start of Counter-Attack on Fascist German Aggressors Marked in Russia

					Moscow, December 7 (KCNA) -- The 70th anniversary of the start of the counter-attack on the fascist German aggressors near Moscow was marked in Russia.
					
					Russian President Dmitri Medvedev laid a bouquet before the memorial tower on the suburbs of Moscow on Dec. 5 in memory of the soldiers who laid down at the battle for defense of Moscow.
					
					Meanwhile, there took place that day a ceremony of laying wreaths and flowers before the Tomb of Unknown Soldier by the Wall of the Kremlin.
					
					Present there were Sergei Sobyanin, mayor of Moscow, members of the Moscow City Government, City Assemblymen, war veterans and delegates of youth organizations and public organization.
					
					An art performance for congratulating defenders of Moscow and war veterans, a meeting with war veterans, an exhibition and other colorful events were held in Moscow on this occasion.

articles.title: Russia Adopts Law for Security in Use of Nuclear Power
articles.content:
Russia Adopts Law for Security in Use of Nuclear Power

					Moscow, December 7 (KCNA) -- Russian President Dmitri Medvedev recently ratified a federal law to modify legal documents of the Russian Federation for ensuring security in the use of nuclear power.  
					
					The law was reportedly adopted at the State Duma on November 22 and approved at the Federation Council on November 25.

articles.title: Russia Starts Building Atomic Power Plant in Vietnam
articles.content:
Russia Starts Building Atomic Power Plant in Vietnam

					Moscow, December 7 (KCNA) -- Russia has started building the first atomic power plant in Vietnam.
					
					According to a Russian state company in charge of the construction, the project was launched within the scope of an inter-governmental agreement between Russia and Vietnam.

articles.title: Election of State Duma Held in Russia
articles.content:
Election of State Duma Held in Russia

					Moscow, December 7 (KCNA) -- The election for the sixth State Duma was held in Russia on Dec. 4.
					
					The chairman of the Central Election Commission informed President Dmitri Medvedev of the election results on Dec. 6.
					
					According to them, the United Russia, the Communist Party, A Just Russia and the Liberal Democratic Party have gained enough votes to enter the new State Duma.
					
					The United Russia won 238 out of the 450 seats in the State Duma.

articles.title: Carrier Flotilla of Russia Starts Long Distance Navigation
articles.content:
Carrier Flotilla of Russia Starts Long Distance Navigation

					Moscow, December 7 (KCNA) -- The carrier flotilla of the Arctic Sea Fleet of Russia on Dec. 6 started long distance navigation to the northeast waters of the Atlantic Ocean and the Mediterranean according to the plan for combat preparations.
					
					Included in the carrier flotilla are plane-loaded cruiser, large anti-submarine destroyer, supply ship, etc.
					
					It is said that the navigation helps the Russian Navy advance to operationally important oceans of the world.

articles.title: Thai King Calls for Unity
articles.content:
Thai King Calls for Unity

					Pyongyang, December 8 (KCNA) -- Thai King Bhumibol Adulyadej has called for his countrymen to unite against the worst floods in half a century. The king spoke to mark his 84th birthday.
					
					Thailand has been severely affected by the ongoing flood crisis, which began in late July. In this regard the king called upon all the people to get firmly united to eradicate the aftermath of the flood damage and ensure social stability.

articles.title: Iran Opposes Foreign Military Presence in Afghanistan
articles.content:
Iran Opposes Foreign Military Presence in Afghanistan

					Pyongyang, December 8 (KCNA) -- Iran turns against any forms of foreign military presence on the soil of its neighboring Afghanistan, the Iranian Foreign Minister Ali Akbar Salehi said on Monday. 
					
					"Certain Western countries seek to extend their military presence in Afghanistan beyond 2014 by maintaining their military bases there.   We deem such an approach contradictory to the efforts toward sustaining stability and security in Afghanistan," Salehi said in a speech at the international conference on Afghanistan in the western German city of Bonn.
					
					"We believe that any international or regional initiative to restore peace and security in Afghanistan could only be successful if they give up the presence of foreign military forces and especially, the founding of foreign military bases in Afghanistan," he said.

articles.title: Indonesia to Build Hundreds of Soccer Fields and Stadiums
articles.content:
Indonesia to Build Hundreds of Soccer Fields and Stadiums

					Pyongyang, December 8 (KCNA) -- Indonesia is paying big efforts to developing soccer.
					
					Indonesia's Minister for Youth and Sports Andi Mallarangeng said on Dec. 3 that hundreds of soccer fields and stadiums will be built throughout the country.
					
					It is said that if the plan is carried out, it will contribute to popularizing soccer and making people pay social attention to it.

articles.title: 54% Japanese Oppose Consumption Tax Hike
articles.content:
54% Japanese Oppose Consumption Tax Hike

					Pyongyang, December 8 (KCNA) -- An opinion poll by the Mainichi Shimbun daily has found that 54 percent of respondents are opposed to Prime Minister Yoshihiko Noda's plan to double the consumption tax rate in stages by the mid-2010s, the paper reported Monday.

articles.title: Occupy D.C. Protest in U.S.
articles.content:
Occupy D.C. Protest in U.S.

					Pyongyang, December 8 (KCNA) -- The Occupy D.C. protest is going on in the capital city of the U.S.
					
					The protesters erected a wooden structure in a square near the White House and staged the Occupy Wall Street demonstration.
					
					When the police tried to dismantle the structure, the protesters stubbornly resisted it.
					
					The police arrested several protesters.

articles.title: Industrial Production Falls in Spain in October
articles.content:
Industrial Production Falls in Spain in October

					Pyongyang, December 8 (KCNA) -- Spain's industrial production fell by 4.2 percent in October this year in comparison to the same month in 2010, according to figures released by the Spanish National Institute of Statistics on Monday.

articles.title: Australian Services Sector Weakens in November
articles.content:
Australian Services Sector Weakens in November

					Pyongyang, December 8 (KCNA) -- Australia's services sector reported weaker sales in November despite strong discounting across the sector, the Australian Industry Group, the nation's leading industry organization said on Monday. 
					
					The Australian Industry Group/Commonwealth Bank Australian Performance of Services Index (PSI) fell 1.1 points to 47.7 points in November, still below the 50-point level, which indicates a contraction in activity.

articles.title: Irish Firms Close
articles.content:
Irish Firms Close

					Pyongyang, December 8 (KCNA) -- A new report from business intelligence analyst Vision-Net showed over 1 800 companies closed in the first 11 months of 2011, and left behind 1.15 billion euro in debts.
					
					An average of five companies a day collapsed in Ireland so far this year, a 20-percent increase on the same period last year, according to new figures released Friday.

articles.title: AIDS Kills 35 000 in Mideast
articles.content:
AIDS Kills 35 000 in Mideast

					Pyongyang, December 8 (KCNA) -- 35 000 have so far died of AIDS in Mideast, according to survey leased on Dec. 4.
					
					AIDS carrier stands at 470 000 at present.
					
					The regional countries are taking measures for preventing its spread.

articles.title: Syrian Armed Forces Carry out Military Practice
articles.content:
Syrian Armed Forces Carry out Military Practice

					Pyongyang, December 8 (KCNA) -- Syrian missile forces have carried out a "practical project" with the aim of testing the missile weaponry in confronting attacks, local daily al-Thawra reported on Monday. 
					
					During the practice held Sunday evening, "the missile forces performed the project with accuracy and achieved distinctive results," the paper said. 
					
					The defense minister of Syria declared that the armed forces will remain loyal to the homeland and defend the interests of the Syrian people. 
					
					He urged the armed forces to remain on high alert to carry out any mission they might be entrusted with.

articles.title: CRPP advierte a la banda de Lee Myung Bak
articles.content:
CRPP advierte a la banda de Lee Myung Bak

					Pyongyang, 8 de diciembre (ACNC) -- Con respecto a que el traidor surcoreano Lee Myung Bak azuza a la escoria humana que insulto atrevidamente la maxima dignidad de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, el portavoz del Comite por la Reunificacion Pacifica de la Patria (CRPP) dio el dia 8 la siguiente respuesta a la ACNC: 
					
					Hace poco, el traidor Lee Myung Bak envio una "carta de estimulo" al tipejo de pesima calana, autor de una novela que mancha absurda y siniestramente la maxima dignidad de la RPDC, hecho que pone muy indignado a todo el mundo. 
					
					En su misiva, el traidor Lee "agradecio" a ese farsante diciendo que su libro lleno de falsificaciones, mentiras y fraudes dio a conocer la realidad del Norte e infundio la voluntad de reunificacion. 
					
					Tal "estimulo" al "escritor" psicopata, de que nadie hace caso, deja conocer el estado psiquico del mismo mandatario surcoreano. 
					
					Aunque tenga mal genio y se encuentre en la situacion miserable por ser repudiado tanto en el interior como en el exterior, el deberia pensar en su honra si es "presidente". 
					
					Sin embargo, estrecha la mano hasta con las escorias humanas, repudiadas en la sociedad surcoreana, a riesgo de ser avergonzado a la vista del mundo. Este hecho demuestra la bajeza del traidor Lee y su situacion tan miserable. 
					
					Lo que no se puede pasar por alto es que Lee no vacila en meter cualesquier mentiras y fraudes si estos sirven para calumniar a la RPDC. 
					
					La realidad hace constar que el es cabecilla de la campana de confrontacion fratricida. 
					
					El esta colmado de locura conflictiva y acecha siempre la oportunidad de danar a la connacional RPDC. 
					
					?Como es posible mejorar las relaciones intercoreanas y lograr la reconciliacion y la unidad de la nacion si ese tipejo se mantiene en el poder del Sur de Corea?
					
					A traves de tal conducta del traidor Lee, pudimos confirmar una vez mas que no se ha cambiado ni se cambiara su verdadera intencion de enfrentarse con la RPDC en desafio a la tendencia de la epoca y a la voluntad del pueblo. 
					
					El pueblo coreano no perdonara jamas a cualquier que se atreva a manchar, aunque en lo minimo, la maxima dignidad de la RPDC.

articles.title: Declaracion conjunta de budistas intercoreanos
articles.content:
Declaracion conjunta de budistas intercoreanos

					Pyongyang, 8 de diciembre (ACNC) -- El Comite Central de la Federacion de Budistas de Corea, la Asociacion Nacional de Religiosos adscrita a la primera entidad, el Movimiento para el Rescate de Tesoros Culturales y el Consejo Nacional de la Orden Budista Jogye, del Sur de Corea hicieron publica el dia 8 una declaracion conjunta de budistas del Norte y el Sur como sigue:
					
					Se han recuperado al unos 80 anos los Libros y Registros de Eventos Reales Conservados en la Habitacion del Rey de Corea arrebatados en el periodo de la ocupacion japonesa por el "Gobierno General de Corea".
					
					Con motivo del centenario de la invencion de la "Anexion de Corea al Japon" en 2010 el gobierno japones decidio devolver 1 205 libros incluyendo el tesoro arriba mencionado, lo cual deviene el resultado de los esfuerzos comunes de los budistas intercoreanos iniciados desde el ano 2006.
					
					No limitandose a tal resultado, los budistas de ambas partes coreanas deben esforzarse mas activamente por recuperar todos los patrimonios culturales de la nacion privados por el imperialismo japones con las fuerzas unidas bajo la bandera de "Entre nosotros, los connacionales".
					
					Y mas adelante, deben juntando las almas de 70 millones de coreanos para demandar con urgencia a Japon la reconsideracion sobre la dominacion colonial, y hacer aporte activo a adelantar la reunificacion de la patria, anhelo de la nacion.
					
					Con motivo de la recuperacion de esos libros y registros con la cooperacion nacional del 15 de junio superando las dificultades y obstaculos de toda indole, nos esforzaremos en conjunto por organizar el "seminario intercoreano por recuperar los tesoros culturales despojados por el imperialismo japones".

articles.title: Sun Yanfeng recibe Orden de Amistad de segunda clase de RPDC
articles.content:
Sun Yanfeng recibe Orden de Amistad de segunda clase de RPDC

					Pyongyang, 8 de diciembre (ACNC) -- Sun Yanfeng, agregado militar de la Embajada de la Republica Popular China acreditado en Corea, recibio el dia 8 en el capitalino Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae la Orden de Amistad de segunda clase de la RPDC.
					
					Sun Yanfeng con ardiente veneracion hacia el Presidente Kim Il Sung y el Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, hizo aporte al desarrollo de las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre los ejercitos de los dos paises. 
					
					 En la ceremonia de otorgamiento participaron el vicepresidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la RPDC, Yang Hyong Sop, los generales y oficiales del EPC, el embajador chino en Corea, Liu Hongcai, y otros miembros de la misma sede diplomatica.
